column4: and some say firefox win32 is faster in wine than native linux version, but i would stay away from that if i could
i just wish ubuntu came with the full vim installed by default as its much nicer and color codes everything
Ubuntu is mostly for mortals - which prefer simpler things such as nano or gedit.
lol but a good install of vim, which is much easier to use would make sense ... unless you needed the space on the live cd i suppose
For beginners, simple modeless text editors such as nano are much simpler. (Esc :wq isn't that obvious compared to nano's Ctrl-X, which is always displayed on screen.)
i know... just voicing my own desires for ubuntu ... simple is good for the new user, and Ubuntu has loads of 'em.
